alert.note: Alert for Madison (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 10:44PM CDT until further notice by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following county, Madison. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving east into the area from Reynolds and Iron counties. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fredericktown, Junction City, Cobalt, Marquand, Buckhorn, Saco, Roselle, Catherine Place and Mine La Motte.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
